title: DPW Street & Sidewalk Evaluation Results, CY22
description:
12/4/2024 NOTE: This dataset will no longer be updated as of 1/1/2023. This page will be deleted in January 2025. Please see the updated dataset linked below:

https://data.sfgov.org/City-Infrastructure/Street-Sidewalk-Maintenance-Standards-Results-Jan-/qya8-uhsz

The Controller's Office's City Services Auditor (CSA) Division has worked with the Department of Public Works (DPW) to develop maintenance standards for streets and sidewalks and schedules and inspect for compliance since July 2004, as mandated by 2003 Prop. C. This data file contains street and sidewalk evaluation results from 1/1/2022 to 12/31/22 under the FY19 standards (v4.0).  Older evaluation results are also available on DataSF but are not comparable due to changes in the way the standards are calculated.  You can also access the annual reports in PDF at "Street Maintenance" section of http://sfcontroller.org/index.aspx?page=49 or https://sf.gov/resource/2022/street-and-sidewalk-maintenance-standards

columns.name: ObjectID
columns.description: Unique identifier for the evaluation

columns.name: Route Location:
columns.description: Description of the location where the evaluation took place

columns.name: Route ID:
columns.description: Unique identifier for the route evaluated

columns.name: Select the statement that best describes the amount and distribution of litter in the street.
columns.description: 1. Street litter rated on a scale of 1-5. 1 = None, 2 = A few traces, 3 = More than a few traces, but no accumulation, 4 = Distributed litter with some accumulation, 5 = Widespread litter with significant accumulation.

columns.name: Does litter obstruct the street?
columns.description: 1. If street litter is present, street litter obstruction is measured by Yes or No. 0 = "No" and 1 = "Yes".

columns.name: Select the statement that best describes the amount and distribution of litter on the sidewalk.
columns.description: 2. Sidewalk litter rated on a scale of 1-5. 1 = None, 2 = A few traces, 3 = More than a few traces, but no accumulation, 4 = Distributed litter with some accumulation, 5 = Widespread litter with significant accumulation.

columns.name: How many large abandoned items are present?
columns.description: 3. Illegal dumping.  The count of abandoned items represents instances of illegal dumping.

columns.name: What types of items are present? (select all that apply)
columns.description: 3. Illegal dumping.  Codes for the types of abandoned items.

columns.name: Other dumped items:
columns.description: 3. Illegal dumping.  Written descriptions of other dumped items that do not fit the categories described in previous question.

columns.name: Does illegal dumping obstruct the street?
columns.description: 3. Illegal dumping.  If illegal dumping is present, illegal dumping street obstruction is measured by Yes or No. 0 = "No" and 1 = "Yes".

columns.name: How many instances of graffiti are present on private property or on the sidewalk or non-painted curb immediately adjacent to private property?
columns.description: 4. Graffiti. The number of instances of graffiti on private property are recorded here. In case more than 100 instances are present for a single evaluation, "101" is reported.

columns.name: How many instances of graffiti are present on SF gov property?
columns.description: 4. Graffiti.  The number of instances of graffiti on SF gov property are recorded here. In case more than 100 instances are present for a single evaluation, "101" is reported.

columns.name: How many instances of graffiti are present on other property?
columns.description: 4. Graffiti.  The number of instances of graffiti on other property are recorded here. In case more than 100 instances are present for a single evaluation, "101" is reported.

columns.name: Select the statement that best describes the amount and distribution of broken glass on the street and sidewalk:
columns.description: 5. Broken glass.  Measured on a scale of 1-5. 1 = None, 2 = A few traces, 3 = More than a few traces but no concentration, 4 = Glass is concentrated in a single line or spot, 5 = Glass is concentrated in multiple lines or spots.

columns.name: How many instances of broken glass are present along the sidewalk and street?
columns.description: 5. Broken glass.  Count of instances/clusters.

columns.name: How many instances of feces are present?
columns.description: 6. Feces. Count of instances/clusters.

columns.name: How many abandoned syringes are present?
columns.description: 7. Syringes . Count of instances/clusters.

columns.name: How many used or opened condoms are present?
columns.description: 8. Condoms . Count of instances/clusters.

columns.name: How many dead animals are present?
columns.description: 9. Dead animals. Count of instances/clusters.

columns.name: Does the route have one or more trash receptacles?
columns.description: 10. Receptacles.  Yes or No. 0 = "No" and 1 = "Yes".

columns.name: Are any trash receptacles overflowing?
columns.description: 10. Receptacles.  If a trash receptacle is present, overflowing receptacles are represented by Yes or No. 0 = "No" and 1 = "Yes".

columns.name: Is sidewalk clearance less than 4 feet wide or 8 feet high at any point?
columns.description: 11. Sidewalk clearance.  Issues are represented by Yes and No. 0 = "No" and 1 = "Yes".

columns.name: If yes, identify the cause (select all that apply)
columns.description: 11. Sidewalk clearance. Codes.

columns.name: Other sidewalk obstructions:
columns.description: 11. Sidewalk clearance.  Free form descriptions

columns.name: Does the sidewalk have any defects that have not been marked for repair?
columns.description: 12. Sidewalk defects.  Existing Defect/repair markings are represented by Yes and No. 0 = "No" and 1 = "Yes".

columns.name: Does the sidewalk have any marked defects that have not been repaired?
columns.description: 12. Sidewalk defects.  Unrepaired sidewalk defects are represented by Yes and No. 0 = "No" and 1 = "Yes".

columns.name: How severe are the pavement defects?
columns.description: 12. Sidewalk defects.  Sidewalk pavement defect severity is measured on a scale of 1-3. 1 = Minor, 2 = Moderate, 3 = Severe.

columns.name: Do you detect any strong unpleasant or offensive odors along the street or sidewalk?
columns.description: 13. Odors.  Presence of strong unpleasant or offensive odors is represented by Yes and No. 0 = "No" and 1 = "Yes".

columns.name: If yes, is the odor from a sewer or catch basin?
columns.description: 13. Odors.  If strong unpleasant or offensive odors are present, Yes and No represent whether or not the source is a sewer or catch basin. 0 = "No" and 1 = "Yes".

columns.name: Does the route have one or more transit shelters?
columns.description: 14. Transit shelters.  Presence of a transit shelter is represented by Yes and No. 0 = "No" and 1 = "Yes".

columns.name: Which of the following issues are present in or on any of the transit shelters along the route?
columns.description: 14. Transit shelters.  If a shelter is present, please provide issue codes.

columns.name: Is this route predominantly residential or commercial/industrial/mixed use?
columns.description: The type of route is either Commercial/Industrial/Mixed Use or Residential. 1 = "Commercial/Industrial/Mixed Use" and 2 = "Residential".

columns.name: CreationDate
columns.description: Evaluation date

columns.name: x
columns.description: Latitude of the street evaluated

columns.name: y
columns.description: Longitude of the street evaluated

columns.name: the_geom
SF Find Neighborhoods 2
columns.description: This column was automatically created in order to record in what polygon from the dataset 'SF Find Neighborhoods' (6qbp-sg9q) the point in column 'the_geom' is located.  This enables the creation of region maps (choropleths) in the visualization canvas and data lens.

columns.name: Analysis Neighborhoods 2
columns.description: This column was automatically created in order to record in what polygon from the dataset 'Analysis Neighborhoods' (ajp5-b2md) the point in column 'the_geom' is located.  This enables the creation of region maps (choropleths) in the visualization canvas and data lens.

columns.name: Current Supervisor Districts 2
columns.description: This column was automatically created in order to record in what polygon from the dataset 'Current Supervisor Districts' (26cr-cadq) the point in column 'the_geom' is located.  This enables the creation of region maps (choropleths) in the visualization canvas and data lens.
